content.question: The amount of bacteria in a petri dish increases at a rate proportional to the amount present. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the amount of bacteria in the dish is 10 grams. At time <math alttext="t equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the amount of bacteria in the dish is 30 grams. What is the amount of bacteria in the dish at time <math alttext="t equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
